namespace.description: The name of the namespace in which Speckle will be deployed.

create_namespace.description: Enabling this will create a new namespace into which Speckle will be deployed

domain.description: The DNS host name at which this Speckle deployment will be reachable

ssl_canonical_url.description: HTTPS protocol will be the preferred protocol for serving this Speckle deployment

cert_manager_issuer.description: The name of the ClusterIssuer kubernetes resource that provides the SSL Certificate

type.description: (Optional) Used to configure which type of NetworkPolicy is deployed. Options are 'kubernetes' or 'cilium'.

namespace.description: The namespace in which the ingress controller is deployed.

controllerName.description: The name of the Kubernetes pod in which the ingress controller is deployed.

docker_image_tag.description: Speckle is published as a Docker Image.  The version of the image which will be deployed is specified by this tag.

imagePullPolicy.description: Determines the conditions when the Docker Images for Speckle should be pulled from the Image registry.

secretName.description: Deprecated, please use individual secret parameters.  This is the name of the Kubernetes Secret resource in which secrets for Speckle are stored. Secrets within this Secret resource may include Postgres and Redis connectin strings, S3 secret values, email server passwords, etc..

file_size_limit_mb.description: This maximum size of any single file (unit is Megabytes) that can be uploaded to Speckle

enable_prometheus_monitoring.description: If enabled, Speckle deploys a Prometheus ServiceMonitor resource

namespace.description: If provided, deploys Speckle's Prometheus resources (e.g. ServiceMonitor) in the given namespace

release.description: If provided, adds the value to a `release` label on all the Prometheus resources deployed by Speckle

podSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The pod Selector yaml object used to uniquely select the prometheus pods within the cluster and given namespace

namespaceSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The namespace selector yaml object used to uniquely select the namespace in which the prometheus pods are deployed

fromEndpoints.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The endpoint selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster endpoint in which the prometheus pods are deployed

useCertificate.description: If enabled, the certificate defined in db.certificate is used to verify TLS connections to the Postgres database

maxConnectionsServer.description: The number of connections to the Postgres database to provide in the connection pool

certificate.description: The x509 public certificate for SSL connections to the Postgres database. Use of this certificate requires db.useCertificate to be enabled and an appropriate value for db.PGSSLMODE provided.

PGSSLMODE.description: This defines the level of security used when connecting to the Postgres database

secretName.description: Required. A secret containing the full connection string to the Postgres database (e.g. in format of `protocol://username:password@host:port/database`) stored within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: Required. The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the connection string.

enabled.description: If enabled, indicates that the Postgres database is hosted externally to the Kubernetes cluster
If enabled, indicates that the Postgres database is hosted withing the same Kubernetes cluster in which Speckle will be deployed

port.description: the port on the server providing the Postgres database (default: "5432")

podSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The pod Selector yaml object used to uniquely select the postgres compatible database pods within the cluster and given namespace

namespaceSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The namespace selector yaml object used to uniquely select the namespace in which the postgres compatible database pods are deployed

endpointSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The endpoint selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster endpoint in which the postgres compatible database pods are deployed

serviceSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The service selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster service providing the postgres compatible database service

enabled.description: If enabled, the s3.endpoint, s3.bucket, and s3.access_key values will be determined from a configMap and the values provided in this helm release ignored.

name.description: The name of the ConfigMap in which values for the keys (`endpoint`, `bucket`, and `access_key`) are provided. Expected to be in the namespace defined by the `namespace` parameter of this Helm Chart.

endpoint.description: The URL at which the s3 compatible storage is hosted. If `s3.configMap.enabled` is true, this value is ignored.

bucket.description: The s3 compatible bucket in which Speckle data will be stored.  If `s3.configMap.enabled` is true, this value is ignored.

access_key.description: The key of the access key used to authenticate with the s3 compatible storage.  If `s3.configMap.enabled` is true, this value is ignored.

secretName.description: Required. A Kubernetes secret containing the s3 secret_key.  This is expected to be the name of an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: Required. The key within the Kubernetes Secret, the value of which is the s3 secret.

create_bucket.description: If enabled, will create a bucket with the given bucket name at this endpoint

region.description: The region in which the bucket resides (or will be created in).

port.description: the port on the server providing the s3 compatible storage (default: "443")

enabled.description: If enabled, indicates that the s3 compatible storage is hosted externally to the Kubernetes cluster
If enabled, indicates that the s3 compatible storage is hosted withing the same Kubernetes cluster in which Speckle will be deployed

podSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The pod Selector yaml object used to uniquely select the s3 compatible storage pods within the cluster and given namespace

namespaceSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The namespace selector yaml object used to uniquely select the namespace in which the s3 compatible storage pods are deployed

endpointSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The endpoint selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster endpoint in which the s3 compatible storage pods are deployed

serviceSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The service selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster service providing the s3 compatible storage service

secretName.description: Required. A secret containing the full connection string to the Redis store (e.g. in format of `protocol://username:password@host:port/database`) stored within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: Required. The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the Redis connection string.

enabled.description: If enabled, indicates that the Redis store is hosted externally to the Kubernetes cluster
If enabled, indicates that the Redis store is hosted withing the same Kubernetes cluster in which Speckle will be deployed

port.description: the port on the server providing the Redis store (default: "6379")

podSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The pod Selector yaml object used to uniquely select the redis store pods within the cluster and given namespace

namespaceSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The namespace selector yaml object used to uniquely select the namespace in which the redis store pods are deployed

endpointSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The endpoint selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster endpoint in which the redis pods are deployed

serviceSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The service selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster service providing the redis store service

replicas.description: The number of instances of the Server pod to be deployed within the cluster.

logLevel.description: The minimum level of logs which will be output. Suitable values are trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, or silent

adminOverrideEnabled.description: Enables the server side admin authz override

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the Session secret.  This is a unique value (can be generated randomly). This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the Session secret as its value.

enabled.description: If enabled, users can register and authenticate with an email address and password.

If enabled, users can authenticate via Google with their Google account credentials. If enabling Google, the `server.auth.google.client_id` parameter is required, and a secret must be provided via the Kubernetes secret referenced in `server.auth.google.clientSecret`.

client_id.description: This is the ID for Speckle that you have registered with Google.

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the Google client secret. This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the Google client secret as its value.

enabled.description: If enabled, users can authenticate via Github with their Github account credentials. If enabling Github authentication, the `server.auth.github.client_id` parameter is required.

client_id.description: This is the ID for Speckle that you have registered with Github

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the GitHub client secret. This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the GitHub client secret as its value.

enabled.description: If enabled, users can authenticate via Azure Active Directory.

org_name.description: This is the Organisation Name that you have registered with Azure

identity_metadata.description: This is the identity metadata for Speckle that you have registered with Azure

issuer.description: This is the issuer name for Speckle that you have registered with Azure

client_id.description: This is the ID for Speckle that you have registered with Azure

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the Azure AD client secret. This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the Azure AD client secret as its value.

additional_domains.description: List of `matchName` or `matchPattern` maps for domains that should be allow-listed for egress in Network Policy. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-portal/azure-portal-safelist-urls?tabs=public-cloud are enabled by default.

port.description: Port on server to connect to. Used to allow egress in Network Policy. Defaults to 443

enabled.description: If enabled, users can authenticate via OpenID Connect identity provider

name.description: This is the name that you want displayed on the login button

discovery_url.description: This is the OIDC discovery URL for the identity provider you want to use

client_id.description: This is the ID for Speckle that you have registered with the OIDC identity provider

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the OIDC client secret. This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the OIDC client secret as its value.

domains.description: List of `matchName` or `matchPattern` maps for domains that should be allow-listed for egress in Network Policy.

enabled.description: If enabled, Speckle can send email to users - for example, email verification for account registration.

host.description: The domain name or IP address of the server hosting the email service.

port.description: The port on the server for the email service.

username.description: The username with which Speckle will authenticate with the email service.

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the email password. This is expected to be provided within the Kubernetes cluster as an opaque Kubernetes Secret. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#opaque-secrets

secretKey.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret holding the email password as its value.

enabled.description: If enabled, indicates that the email server is hosted externally to the Kubernetes cluster
If enabled, indicates that the email server is hosted withing the same Kubernetes cluster in which Speckle will be deployed

podSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The pod Selector yaml object used to uniquely select the email server pods within the cluster and given namespace

namespaceSelector.description: (Kubernetes Network Policy only) The namespace selector yaml object used to uniquely select the namespace in which the email server pods are deployed

endpointSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The endpoint selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster endpoint in which the email server pods are deployed

serviceSelector.description: (Cilium Network Policy only) The service selector yaml object used to uniquely select the in-cluster service providing the email server
